variants.title: Unnatural Feature. How does it affect its surroundings?
Natural Feature. Describe how they notice it and what sets it apart.
limited area of an another Terrain type
Evidence. Consider the implications and be ready for them to take the bait.
Creature. Not an immediate threat, but might become one.
Structure. Who built it? Is it connected to anything else they made nearby?
Unnatural Entity. Describe it—creepy, twisted, awe-inspiring.
Beast . Start with a real-world creature, then put a spin in it.
Humanoid. If you roll a classic fantasy species, adapt it to your setting.
fey (Tiny: It’s much smaller than a halfling.)
ogre/troll (Large: It’s much bigger than a human, about as big as a cart.)
cyclops/giant (Large: It’s much bigger than a human, about as big as a cart.)
slime/ooze (Amorphous: Its anatomy and organs are bizarre and unnatural.)
creation (Construct: It was made, not born)
dragon/colossus (Huge: It’s as big as a small house or larger.)
Unusual + Huge (It’s as big as a small house or larger.)
Rare + Huge (It’s as big as a small house or larger.)
Solitary: It lives and fights alone.
Group: Usually seen in small numbers, 3–6 or so.
Horde: Where there’s one, there’s more. A lot more.
Tiny: It’s much smaller than a halfling.
Large: It’s much bigger than a human, about as big as a cart.
Huge: It’s as big as a small house or larger.
Amorphous: Its anatomy and organs are bizarre and unnatural.
Cautious: It prizes survival over aggression.
Construct: It was made, not born.
Devious: Its main danger lies beyond the simple clash of battle.
Intelligent: It’s smart enough that some individuals pick up other skills. The GM can adapt the monster by adding tags to reflect specific training, like a mage or warrior.
Magical: It is by nature magical through and through.
Organized: It has a group structure that aids it in survival. Defeating one may cause the wrath of others. One may sound an alarm.
Planar: It’s from beyond this world.
Stealthy: It can avoid detection and prefers to attack with the element of surprise.
Terrifying: Its presence and appearance evoke fear.

title: Dungeon Discovery. A starting point: extrapolate, embellish, integrate.
Dungeon Danger. If they would notice, show signs of an approaching threat.

variants.title: Life of servitude/oppression: +Meek: they accept their lowly lot, and will do degrading or unreasonable things without needing to Follow Orders.
Past their prime: -1 to Quality, +1 -Wise: they know all about ____, and can roll +Quality to Spout Lore about it on your behalf. Examples: Woods-wise, Sea-wise, Herb-wise.
Has lived a life of danger: +2 tags
Has lived a life of privilege: +1 tag
